data.title: Glendene Grant BTR show: guests ANDREW KOOMAN & MARK PALMER
data.meta_description: Join me tonight to welcome my special guest: ANDREW KOOMAN. I met Andrew when I was a guest speaker at the Raise Their Voice: The Trafficked + Exploited OFFICIAL website: http://andrewkooman.com/ SHE HAS A NAME website: http://shehasaname.net/andrew-kooman I met Andrew when I was a guest speaker at the Raise Their Voice: The Trafficked + Exploited a year ago (April 15 & 16, 2011). Andrew writes for the page, stage, and screen. His writing has been published around the world and translated into 10 languages. Andrew is the author of She Has A Name, a stage play that had a critically acclaimed sold out World Premiere February 2011 in Calgary, Alberta, followed by a sold out run in Red Deer, Alberta in March of 2011. The play is touring Canada May – October 2012 in 12 cities, from Halifax to Victoria. Andrew works as a PR professional and is based in Red Deer, Alberta where he helped to found Raise Their Voice, a non-profit organization that creatively addresses issues of injustice. For the 2nd hour of the show I will be joined by Mark A. Palmer with Jessica's Law Now to talk about missing 6-year-old Isabel Mercedes Celis and AMBER ALERTS. JESSICA'S LAW NOW website: http://jessicaslawnow.wordpress.com/
data.text:
Join me tonight to welcome my special guest: ANDREW KOOMAN. I met Andrew when I was a guest speaker at the Raise Their Voice: The Trafficked + Exploited

OFFICIAL website: http://andrewkooman.com/

SHE HAS A NAME website: http://shehasaname.net/andrew-kooman

I met Andrew when I was a guest speaker at the Raise Their Voice: The Trafficked + Exploited a year ago (April 15 & 16, 2011).

Andrew writes for the page, stage, and screen. His writing has been published around the world and translated into 10 languages. Andrew is the author of She Has A Name, a stage play that had a critically acclaimed sold out World Premiere February 2011 in Calgary, Alberta, followed by a sold out run in Red Deer, Alberta in March of 2011. The play is touring Canada May â€“ October 2012 in 12 cities, from Halifax to Victoria.

Andrew works as a PR professional and is based in Red Deer, Alberta where he helped to found Raise Their Voice, a non-profit organization that creatively addresses issues of injustice.

For the 2nd hour of the show I will be joined by Mark A. Palmer with Jessica's Law Now to talk about missing 6-year-old Isabel Mercedes Celis and AMBER ALERTS.
